page.title: 11Oakley Church
page.content: The church dedicated to St. Mary is built in stone. The tower is the oldest part of the building dating from the middle of the twelth century. The tower clock has only one hand and is one of the oldest in this country, built in 162O it still keeps accurate time. In the churchyard is part of an old cross, originally used as an outdoor pulpit, now listed as an ancient monument. Anabel Chamberlain, daughter of Sir Richard lies buried in the wall of the church, for when she died she hadn't decided where to be buried. By the north door is a parish chest, the lid consisting of a roughly hollowed out tree trunk. The east window contains fragments of coloured glass, all that was left after a scorching farm fire. The font was built in the C15th and is built out of stone.
